feature_section_1.title: Co-developing renewable energy projects with communities

items.subtitle: Community-Ferténergie partnership
paragraphs: Your community:
- Has existing or planned roofs suitable for solar installations.
- Is aware of private and business building projects.
- Wants to involve its citizens in an energy transition project.
- Wants to commit to projects with one or more elected officials.

items.subtitle: A structured approach for success
paragraphs: Ferténergie:
- Will provide a pre-assessment of various points to check project feasibility (agreements, insurance issues, loan guarantees, building plans, surrounding works, etc.).
Your community:
- Will need to make appropriate decisions to enable the partnership (making roofs available).
- Can use the project to raise awareness among families, businesses, and children about energy efficiency (positive energy challenge, energy management).

feature_section_2.title: Management and coordination of citizen projects

items.subtitle: Mastering the key stages of project development
paragraphs: A citizen renewable energy project involves several key stages: site identification, feasibility studies, financial planning, local consultation, administrative procedures, and finally commissioning the installation.

items.subtitle: A network of key stakeholders
paragraphs: The success of a project also depends on the right network: local authorities, technical partners, and committed citizens are all essential.

items.subtitle: Identifying and anticipating problems
paragraphs: Anticipating potential difficulties is crucial to ensuring a project's success. Thanks to our experience, we can now identify the main risks from the very first stages.

about_us.title: Info & Contact
texts: Our goal is to develop photovoltaic projects on both private and public roofs, as well as on available land in the region.

items.subtitle: Creation of SAS Ferténergie
paragraphs: - Initial share capital of €10,100 supported by a management board of 8 members.
- 35 members as of December 6, 2020 with capital of €26,000

items.subtitle: The members
paragraphs: - Subscribe to at least one share of €120.
- Each member has one vote regardless of their shareholding.
- No one can hold more than 20% of the share capital.
